text: ਰਾਗੁ ਕਾਨੜਾ ਬਾਣੀ ਨਾਮਦੇਵ ਜੀਉ ਕੀ
section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Raag Kaanraa, The Word Of Naam Dayv Jee:

transliteration.text: rāg kānarā bānī nāmadēv jīu kī

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: One Universal Creator God. By The Grace Of The True Guru:

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: Such is the Sovereign Lord, the Inner-knower, the Searcher of Hearts;

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. The personality conveyed has a magnetism, which makes you think of them as your own and is able to win you over with its remarkable qualities and outlook.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਜੈਸੇ ਦਰਪਨ ਮਾਹਿ ਬਦਨ ਪਰਵਾਨੀ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He sees everything as clearly as one's face reflected in a mirror. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: jaisē darapan māh badan paravānī .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. The personality conveyed has a magnetism, which makes you think of them as your own and is able to win you over with its remarkable qualities and outlook.

text: ਬਸੈ ਘਟਾ ਘਟ ਲੀਪ ਨ ਛੀਪੈ ॥
section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He dwells in each and every heart; no stain or stigma sticks to Him.

transliteration.text: basai ghatā ghat līp n shīpai .

melody.description: Kaanara invokes feelings of being overcome by a personality, which is so impressive that its character is difficult to stop thinking about. The personality conveyed has a magnetism, which makes you think of them as your own and is able to win you over with its remarkable qualities and outlook.

section: Kaanara - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: He is liberated from bondage; He does not belong to any social class. ||1||

translation.text: so does Naam Dayv's Beloved Lord and Master appear. ||2||1||
